revised_title: The Role and Mode of Action of Alkali-metal Ions in Bacterial Metabolism
tldr: This article discusses the role of positive alkali-metal ions, such as potassium and rubidium, in the metabolism of Bact. lactis aerogenes. The authors propose that these ions accompany negative phosphate ions into the cell and can be incorporated into a structure involving phosphorylated intermediates and enzyme surfaces. This binding helps protect the cell from the action of hydrions.
